page.title: 02BLEND OF OLD AND NEW RISELEY
page.content: The core of the old village is still the High Street, running parallel with the brook. New owners of the old timbered houses and cottages have made additions and alterations, usually sympathetic with what was built 300 years ago. The brook supports much wild life, including many not so wild ducks, who regularly hold up the traffic while they take their time crossing from one favourite source of food to the next. The Church, no longer in the centre of the Parish as it was before the seventeenth century, stands high on the edge of the fields, and is once more attracting larger congregations. The Methodist Church too, in its 20th century building, has numerous activities. (to be continued)
